In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the **Barbarian** is one of the [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") from *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that is available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

Barbarians can be of [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") or [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), and can be a [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)"), [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)"), [lycanthrope](/wiki/Lycanthrope_\(starting_race\) "Lycanthrope (starting race)"), or [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_SLASH%27EM\) "Vampire (starting race in SLASH'EM)").

## Starting equipment

Each Barbarian starts with the following equipment:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- Either of these weapon sets (with equal probability):[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

  - a +0 [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") and a +0 [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe")
  - a +0 [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe") and a +0 [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")

- a +0 [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail")

- 2-4 [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")

- a [torch](/wiki/Torch "Torch") (1⁄6 chance or 16.67%)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Barbarians know the appearances of all non-[magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") weapons and armor. Orcish Barbarians receive an [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword") in place of a short sword, [orcish ring mail](/wiki/Orcish_ring_mail "Orcish ring mail") in place of ring mail, and 2 additional stacks of 1-2 random [comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible"). Elven Barbarians receive an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword") in place of a short sword. Drow Barbarians receive a [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)") in place of a short sword.

The Barbarian's default starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") named Idefix.

## Intrinsics

Barbarians gain the following intrinsic [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") upon reaching the given [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- Level 1: [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Level 7: [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- Level 15: [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")

Barbarians start with *Basic* skill in axe, bare-handed combat, and either short sword or two-handed sword depending on their starting weapons.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Techniques

Barbarians can learn the [disarm](/wiki/Disarm "Disarm") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

|           |                                                              |
| --------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Level** | **Technique**                                                |
| 1         | [Berserk](/wiki/Berserk_\(technique\) "Berserk (technique)") |

## Special rules

Barbarians are charged 3 times the normal price when purchasing items from a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), applied after [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") adjustments and before additional upcharges for an angry [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") and/or a purchase made in [the black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)").[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

The barbarian's attack messages replace most instances of "hit" with "smite" (e.g. "You smite the goblin!"), but this is flavor text with no gameplay effect.

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

- XL 1–2: Plunderer/Plunderess
- XL 3–5: Pillager
- XL 6–9: Bandit
- XL 10–13: Brigand
- XL 14–17: Raider
- XL 18–21: Reaver
- XL 22–25: Slayer
- XL 26–29: Chieftain/Chieftainess
- XL 30: Conqueror/Conqueress

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The Barbarian pantheon is based on [Robert E. Howard's](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_E._Howard "wikipedia:Robert E. Howard") *[Conan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conan_the_Barbarian "wikipedia:Conan the Barbarian")* mythos.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11) Their first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") is [Cleaver](/wiki/Cleaver "Cleaver"), and their second sacrifice gift is [Deathsword](/wiki/Deathsword "Deathsword").

- Lawful: [Mitra](/wiki/Mitra "Mitra")
- Neutral: [Crom](/wiki/Crom "Crom")
- Chaotic: [Set](/wiki/Set "Set")

## Quest

- *Main article: [Barbarian quest](/wiki/Barbarian_quest "Barbarian quest")*

The Barbarian's [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees them fight [Thoth Amon](/wiki/Thoth_Amon "Thoth Amon") for [The Heart of Ahriman](/wiki/The_Heart_of_Ahriman "The Heart of Ahriman"), an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). While carried, it confers [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") in addition to acting as a luck item like other luckstones, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to toggle controlled [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"), even if already levitating: after invoking this effect, the hero can return to the ground by pressing [>](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket"), or else by dropping or stashing the artifact.

## Strategy

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those."*

### Character creation

A drow Barbarian is an easy race-role combination for SLASH'EM: Barbarians excel at [bare-handed combat](/wiki/Bare-handed_combat "Bare-handed combat"), and drow fighting bare-handed can put monsters to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") - this is an immense boon for the difficult melee environment of the SLASH'EM early game, and should compensate for the lower damage; the starting weapons can be wielded against monsters with [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"). Since drow are restricted in [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), a good idea is to alternate between the primary weapon and bare-handed combat as needed once the hero has obtained their desired [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") weapon.

### Early game

Being overcharged in shops for both their role, combined with their low starting charisma, makes it very difficult for Barbarians to afford most items found in a shop—this is further complicated by changes to the base price of especially-desirable items, including the [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") whose cost is increased to 1000[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm"). As a result, barbarians are more likely to struggle with finding a better weapon for fighting monsters than their starting ones, and may have to rely on finding an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") for sacrifice or [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") or obtaining a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish"). Fortunately, [spears](/wiki/Spear "Spear") are much more common, and can serve as a viable ranged option for Barbarians willing to sacrifice some of their usually-high [carrying capacity](/wiki/Carrying_capacity "Carrying capacity").

In terms of sacrifice gifts, Cleaver is simply a stronger battle-axe with +3 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +6 damage bonuses, while Deathsword is a two-handed sword that has +5 to-hit and deals +14 damage against [humans](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)"). While Cleaver is better for general-purpose combat, Deathsword can be useful as a specialty weapon against early hostiles such as [muggers](/wiki/Mugger "Mugger") and [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Werecreature (SLASH'EM)"), or even against shopkeepers for a particularly [murderous](/wiki/Murder "Murder") Barbarian. Unfortunately, Deathsword requires commitment of skill points to two-handed swords, which is typically neglected by players even when starting with one—both weapons are also usually outclassed later on, despite Deathsword's decent range of bonus damage targets that includes [barracks](/wiki/Barracks "Barracks") (full of [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") and their higher-ups) and even Thoth Amon.

For Barbarians seeking other artifacts, [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") is still respectable for neutral Barbarians, with a flat +5 to-hit bonus and a higher 1⁄10 chance of [beheading](/wiki/Beheading "Beheading") targets. For chaotic Barbarians, [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") is only slightly stronger than in *NetHack* and finds itself outpaced by many other chaotic artifact weapons; its [level draining](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") are still a powerful early-game aid, and drain resistance is of much more relevant throughout SLASH'EM. A spoiled or seasoned player may also try for the [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell"), since Barbarians can reach Skilled in [clubs](/wiki/Club "Club") and the flat +3 to-hit and +20 damage bonuses keep it relevant well into the end game. Furthermore, any hero that can perform two-weapon combat is capable of wielding two artifacts should they so desire—note that an offhand Stormbringer will *remain* as [bloodthirsty](/wiki/Bloodthirsty "Bloodthirsty") as ever.

In SLASH'EM, the Barbarian is one of the roles from NetHack that is available to the hero.

Barbarians can be of neutral or chaotic alignment, and can be a human, doppelganger, orc, elf, drow, lycanthrope, or vampire.

Starting equipment

Each Barbarian starts with the following equipment:[1]

  • Either of these weapon sets (with equal probability):[2]
    • a +0 two-handed sword and a +0 axe
    • a +0 battle-axe and a +0 short sword
  • a +0 ring mail
  • 2-4 food rations
  • a torch (1⁄6 chance or 16.67%)[3]

Barbarians know the appearances of all non-magical weapons and armor. Orcish Barbarians receive an orcish short sword in place of a short sword, orcish ring mail in place of ring mail, and 2 additional stacks of 1-2 random comestibles. Elven Barbarians receive an elven short sword in place of a short sword. Drow Barbarians receive a dark elven short sword in place of a short sword.

The Barbarian's default starting pet is a little dog named Idefix.

Intrinsics

Barbarians gain the following intrinsic properties upon reaching the given experience levels:[4]

  • Level 1: poison resistance
  • Level 7: speed
  • Level 15: stealth

Barbarians start with Basic skill in axe, bare-handed combat, and either short sword or two-handed sword depending on their starting weapons.[7]

The barbarian's attack messages replace most instances of "hit" with "smite" (e.g. "You smite the goblin!"), but this is flavor text with no gameplay effect.

==Special rules==
Barbarians are charged 3 times the normal price when purchasing items from a [[shop]], applied after [[charisma]] adjustments and before additional upcharges for an angry [[shopkeeper]] and/or a purchase made in [[Black market (SLASH'EM)|the black market]].{{refsrc|shk.c|2348|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} 

The barbarian's attack messages replace most instances of "hit" with "smite" (e.g. "You smite the goblin!"), but this is flavor text with no gameplay effect.

==Quest==
{{main|Barbarian quest}}
The Barbarian's [[Quest]] sees them fight [[Thoth Amon]] for [[The Heart of Ahriman]], an [[artifact]] [[luckstone]]. While carried, it confers [[stealth]] in addition to acting as a luck item like other luckstones, and can be [[invoked]] to toggle controlled [[levitation]], even if already levitating: after invoking this effect, the hero can return to the ground by pressing {{kbd|>}}, or else by dropping or stashing the artifact.

==Strategy==
{{todo|Detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those.}}

===Character creation===
A drow Barbarian is an easy race-role combination for SLASH'EM: Barbarians excel at [[bare-handed combat]], and drow fighting bare-handed can put monsters to [[sleep]] - this is an immense boon for the difficult melee environment of the SLASH'EM early game, and should compensate for the lower damage; the starting weapons can be wielded against monsters with [[sleep resistance]]. Since drow are restricted in [[twoweapon]]ing, a good idea is to alternate between the primary weapon and bare-handed combat as needed once the hero has obtained their desired [[artifact]] weapon.

===Early game===
Being overcharged in shops for both their role, combined with their low starting charisma, makes it very difficult for Barbarians to afford most items found in a shop—this is further complicated by changes to the base price of especially-desirable items, including the [[magic lamp]] whose cost is increased to 1000[[zm]]. As a result, barbarians are more likely to struggle with finding a better weapon for fighting monsters than their starting ones, and may have to rely on finding an [[altar]] for sacrifice or [[crowning]] or obtaining a [[wish]]. Fortunately, [[spear]]s are much more common, and can serve as a viable ranged option for Barbarians willing to sacrifice some of their usually-high [[carrying capacity]].

In terms of sacrifice gifts, Cleaver is simply a stronger battle-axe with +3 [[to-hit]] and +6 damage bonuses, while Deathsword is a two-handed sword that has +5 to-hit and deals +14 damage against [[Human (monster attribute)|humans]]. While Cleaver is better for general-purpose combat, Deathsword can be useful as a specialty weapon against early hostiles such as [[mugger]]s and [[Werecreature (SLASH'EM)|werecreatures]], or even against shopkeepers for a particularly [[murder]]ous Barbarian. Unfortunately, Deathsword requires commitment of skill points to two-handed swords, which is typically neglected by players even when starting with one—both weapons are also usually outclassed later on, despite Deathsword's decent range of bonus damage targets that includes [[barracks]] (full of [[soldier]]s and their higher-ups) and even Thoth Amon.

For Barbarians seeking other artifacts, [[Vorpal Blade]] is still respectable for neutral Barbarians, with a flat +5 to-hit bonus and a higher {{frac|10}} chance of [[beheading]] targets. For chaotic Barbarians, [[Stormbringer]] is only slightly stronger than in ''NetHack'' and finds itself outpaced by many other chaotic artifact weapons; its [[level drain]]ing and [[drain resistance]] are still a powerful early-game aid, and drain resistance is of much more relevant throughout SLASH'EM. A spoiled or seasoned player may also try for the [[Bat from Hell]], since Barbarians can reach Skilled in [[club]]s and the flat +3 to-hit and +20 damage bonuses keep it relevant well into the end game. Furthermore, any hero that can perform two-weapon combat is capable of wielding two artifacts should they so desire—note that an offhand Stormbringer will ''remain'' as [[bloodthirsty]] as ever.
